p: We compared the effect of each HIV disruption scenario on HIV programmes to the direct effects from a COVID-19 epidemic in each respective country. Three models providing publicly available COVID-19 mortality estimates for each country in the case of an unmitigated epidemic were found via a literature search. Modelled projections from Walker et al. [3] use three scenarios of epidemic spread, with the assumption that the basic reproduction number for COVID-19, R 0, is 2.3 ( Table 2). Results are also compared to projections from an online model by Pearson et al. [11] that used relatively similar assumptions, and a further model by Cabore et al., from authors at the WHO Regional Office for Africa, which uses different assumptions [12].
